subject: Art & Design
title: Sustainable Architecture: Building Green
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sustainable Architecture: Building Green usable.

hook.text: Buildings produce 40% of global carbon emissions. Architecture isn't just an art problem â€” it's a climate problem.

buildup.text: Sustainable architecture minimizes energy use through passive design: orientation, insulation, natural ventilation.

discovery.text: Green roofs absorb rainwater, reduce heat, and create habitats. Living walls filter air and reduce cooling costs.

twist.text: Ancient buildings in the Middle East used wind towers and thick walls for passive cooling .

climax.text: Mass timber construction stores carbon instead of emitting it. Wood is making a comeback in modern skyscrapers.

punchline.text: The most sustainable building isn't high-tech. It's high-thought.
